etymologies: Old English lempedu, from medieval Latin lampreda ‘limpet, lamprey’

definitions: a marine mollusk with a shallow conical shell and a broad muscular foot, found clinging tightly to rocks.

notes.text: Patellidae, Fissurellidae (the keyhole limpets), and other families, class Gastropoda: numerous species, including the common limpet (Patella vulgata)

shortDefinitions: marine mollusc which has shallow conical shell and broad muscular foot

definitions: used in comparisons to refer to people and things that cling tightly

examples.text: the couples on the floor were clinging to each other like limpets

shortDefinitions: used to refer to refer to people and things that cling tightly
